repnme.cdata!: Oman - Power and Water Studies Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power and Water Studies Project for
            Oman consisted of the preparation of studies necessary for
            the Government to undertake the rehabilitation and expansion
            of the power and water supply sector in the short and medium
            term and to improve institutional arrangements. The loan was
            approved in May 1977 and became effective in September 1977.
            Loan received were substantially lower than original
            estimates and US$ 411,399 or 27 percent of the loan was
            eventually cancelled. The consultants mobilized rapidly and
            produced their reports with diligence. The Government
            accepted these reports, except the one on institutional
            aspects which it found inappropriate. The Bank concurred
            with this view. The project was very successful, the major
            objective of rehabilitating and expanding the power and
            water supply sector having been rapidly undertaken by the
            Government. Supplies of electricity and water have already
            improved dramatically while water losses have been
            substantially reduced.

18196452.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!: Oman - Power and Water Studies Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will provide
            consultants' services (i) to prepare a short-term
            (1977-80) and a medium-term (1981-85) program for high
            priority investments necessary for the development of
            electricity and water in the main urban and rural growth
            centers; (ii) to prepare a broad master plan for priority
            future projects required to meet the long-term (1986-95)
            requirements; and (iii) to recommend improvements in the
            legislation, structure, organization, finance, procedures
            and operations of the power and water sectors.
